results.title: On the Right Track
results.brief_description: A Department of Conservation, Forests and Lands Program. Examines the Code of Forest Practices which was set to ensure careful logging use of our valuable forests to protect them for future generations.

results.title: On the outer
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Russell Toose
results.brief_description: Investigates the plight of two of Sydney’s homeless men - one a widower in his sixties, the other a young man in his twenties - against a background of their fellow homeless people and the hostels where they live. Reporter: Richard Oxenburgh. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: On the nose
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
An introduction to the sense of smell. Animation is used to illustrate the operations of the smell receptors in the nasal cavities and how this information is processed by the brain. Clearly defines the concept of smelling and recognition of odours.

results.title: On the move
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Suzanne Baker, Alex Ezard and Graham Chase
results.brief_description: Sister Audrey Tomlinson and a team of several other nurses and aides describe their work and conditions. They travel around Queensland caring for Aborigines, and teach them basic preventive medicine.

results.title: On the loose: three stories about leaving school
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Health, Lyn Norfor and Jane Oehr
results.brief_description: A trilogy about three teenagers seeking their independence in the outside world after finishing school. The three stories show the problems faced by a generation leaving school in the mid 1980s - boredom with school (“Exit Eddie Leech”), sexual pressures in the workplace (“Ring of Confidence”), and keeping a job (“Beginner’s luck”).

results.title: On the level: a little help from my friends
results.brief_description: Two boys work part-time packing fish on the docks. However, one continually abuses his friendship with the other by failing to keep appointments and not honoring promises. He dismisses his unreliability by saying that his friend will understand and that’s what friends are for. His casual attitude towards his responsibility eventually causes both himself and his friend to lose their jobs. A good discussion starter for addressing issues about expectations of friendship, dishonesty and sexism. Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: On the inside
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Michael Adams
results.brief_description: The Outward Bound Training School and its effect on the student’s personality through the four-week course and its new and exciting experiences. The commentary consists mainly of the students’ own thoughts and words as they react to the many physical and mental challenges that they encounter during a course, giving them a deeper understanding of themselves and others.

results.title: On the highway
results.brief_description: Long distance driving on highways needs extra care. David Mackay, a prominent racing driver explains techniques and adds a few tips of his own. Begins with images of the Southern Aurora train as it speeds through the countryside approaching Sydney.
